intro: Conostylis aculeata subsp. cygnorum, commonly known as the Swan River conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a member of the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly foliage and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or near-coastal regions. It is a small shrub, usually reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray. This subspecies is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
